page.title: 07EVENTS IN BYGONE DAYS
page.content: The fifteenth century church, whose tower dominates the village was used to house captured prisoners after the most important local event historically. This was The{Battle of {Sedgemoor in 1685.}The last battle fought on English soil,between{King {James the second;the Catholic King, and{James,Duke of}Monmouth,the {Protestant}claimant to the throne and King James's nephew.The Duke landed at {Lyme Regis}and after travelling around the West of England with his poorly trained army,attacked the Royalist Army, camped behind the Bussex rhyne outside the village in the early hours of July the sixth.The mainly civilian army of the Duke,with their crude weapons,were no match for the Royalists ,all professional soldiers,and Monmouth's men were defeated in a gruesome bloodbath.
